ygData.subject: Timestepping through neurons in NEAT and HyperNEAT
ygData.msgSnippet: Please correct me if I m wrong.  My understanding of recurrence and neuron links in NEAT is that during each timestep new input data is presented to the ANN

Please correct me if I'm wrong.  My understanding of recurrence and
neuron =
links in NEAT is that during each timestep new input data is
presented to t=
he ANN and travels to the next neuron until ultimately
reaching the output.=
  Therefore, using the NEAT structure at
http://www.cs.ucf.edu/~kstanley/ne=
at.html
<http://www.cs.ucf.edu/%7Ekstanley/neat.html>  it would take 3 time=
steps
for activation from input 1 to traverse neurons 16, 269 and then 5,
a=
lthough data is also going directly from 1 to 5 (through a direct link)
in =
one step.

If the above is correct, how do the HyperNEAT timesteps work?  U=
sing the
model from http://eplex.cs.ucf.edu/hyperNEATpage/HyperNEAT.html
<h=
ttp://eplex.cs.ucf.edu/hyperNEATpage/HyperNEAT.html%20>  does [0, 0.5,
1 , =
1] get input, then [0.5, 0, 1, 0.5] next?  If so, it would seem to
me the o=
rder you traversed the points in the substrate would affect the
output.  Or=
, do you keep the "state" of each link activation stored
separately from on=
e input substrate to another (one checkerboard play to
another); in other w=
ords, are you keeping (4096 + 64) "states" for each
timestep?

--Todd

<font face=3D"arial">Please correct me if I'm wrong.  My understanding=
 of recurrence and neuron links in NEAT is that during each timestep new in=
put data is presented to the ANN and travels to the next neuron until ultim=
ately reaching the output.  Therefore, using the NEAT structure at <a =
href=3D"http://www.cs.ucf.edu/%7Ekstanley/neat.html">http://www.cs.ucf.edu/=
~kstanley/neat.html</a> it would take 3 timesteps for activation from =
input 1 to traverse neurons 16, 269 and then 5, although data is also going=
 directly from 1 to 5 (through a direct link) in one step.<br><br>If the ab=
ove is correct, how do the HyperNEAT timesteps work?  Using the model =
from <a href=3D"http://eplex.cs.ucf.edu/hyperNEATpage/HyperNEAT.html%20">ht=
tp://eplex.cs.ucf.edu/hyperNEATpage/HyperNEAT.html</a> does [0, 0.5, 1 , 1]=
 get input, then [0.5, 0, 1, 0.5] next?  If so, it would seem to me th=
e order you traversed the points in the substrate would affect the output.&=
nbsp; Or, do you keep the "state" of each link activation stored separately=
 from one input substrate to another (one checkerboard play to another); in=
 other words, are you keeping (4096 + 64) "states" for each timestep?<br><b=
r>--Todd<br></font><br>
